title: 109_hr794
content: Colorado River Indian Reservation Boundary Correction Act - Declares that the boundaries of the Colorado River Indian Reservation are the boundaries delineated by the Robbins Survey of 1875 and affirmed by the Harrington Resurvey of 1912 . Restores to the Reservation all right, title, and interest of the United States to those lands within such boundaries that were excluded from the Reservation pursuant to Executive Order No. 2273 , which shall be held in trust by the United States on behalf of the Colorado River Indian Tribes. Declares that land taken into trust under this Act shall neither be considered to have been taken into trust for gaming nor be used for gaming.
